themes: funding inequity between large and small venues
perceived favoritism towards well-known local artists
concern about industry politics influencing funding
need for resources to reach those most in need
key_phrases: Funding should go to the artists and venues that really could use the money/resources
not to the larger (live nation run) venues
the same handful of well known local artists that play into the politics in the industry
barriers_identified: funds going to large, corporate-run venues
funds concentrated among a small group of well-known artists
solutions_proposed: direct funding to artists and venues most in need instead of large venues and repeat recipients
